old_regulations.summary: Establishes a regulatory framework for virtual financial assets, requiring licensing for issuers and service providers, with emphasis on AML compliance and investor protection. Fines up to €150,000 for violations.
Creates the Malta Digital Innovation Authority (MDIA) to certify DLT platforms and smart contracts, ensuring technology reliability and consumer protection in the digital asset space.

old_regulations.update_title: Innovative Technology Arrangements and Services Act 2018
old_regulations.summary: Provides a framework for registration and regulation of technology service providers and innovative technology arrangements, including blockchain-based platforms and smart contracts.

amount_based: Transaction amount > 3× user's historical average (violates basic AML thresholds under VFA Act)
Daily total amount > 2× user's usual daily total
Single transaction exceeding €15,000 requires enhanced due diligence
frequency_based: Transactions per day > 2× user's normal frequency
More than 10 transactions in a single day triggers review
location_based: Transaction from a new country not seen in history
Rapid country switching within short time (geo-hopping)
behavioural_pattern: Inconsistent behaviour vs declared profile (e.g., high volume from low-activity history)
Sudden change in transaction currency patterns

rules.rule: Impossible geo hop (actual time < min travel time)
